Read GFF Annotations

Source: R/readGFF.R
readGFF.Rd

The GFF (General Feature Format) format consists of one line per feature, each containing 9 columns of data, plus optional track definition lines. The GTF (General Transfer Format) is identical to GFF version 2.

readGFF(file)

Arguments

file

string. File path.

Value

GRanges.

Details

Column names follow the conventions defined by Ensembl.

See also

  • Ensembl

  • Gencode

Other Read Functions: loadDataAsName, loadData, loadRemoteData, readFileByExtension, readJSON, readYAML

Examples

x <- readGFF("http://basejump.seq.cloud/example.gtf")
#> Reading example.gtf
summary(x)
#> [1] "GRanges object with 95 ranges and 22 metadata columns"
as.data.frame(x) %>% glimpse()
